subject: RE: [junit] All tests run when trying to run one test
msgSnippet: We have the exact problem.  I was told it s a bug in Eclipse.  I sure hope they fix it soon, though!  Our workaround is to create a test suite for each test
messageBody:
We have the exact problem. I was told it's a bug in Eclipse. I sure
hope they fix it soon, though! Our workaround is to create a test suite
for each test method, and then run that suite. Yucky, but it works.


Todd.


-----Original Message-----
From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
Brad Younie
Sent: Monday, October 08, 2007 8:28 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] All tests run when trying to run one test

I'm using JUnit4 inside Eclipse 3.2.2. When I tell it to run a single
test, it will instead run all of the tests in the class up to and
including the one I want, but will only give the results of the one I
specified.

This is fine for my normal unit tests, but I also use JUnit for my
integration tests, and some of those tests can take some time to
complete. If I choose to run a test that is physically near the bottom
of the class, it can take minutes before it will run my test.

Is there a way to really make it only run the one test you specify?
